jobDescription: As a Data Scientist at Amne, youll join a young, growing team as we build the worlds fastest and simplest home transaction experience.Responsibilities will include: Using data to deeply understand user needsBuilding, improving and maintaining our analytics infrastructure to help continuously inform business decisionsBuilding and improving industry-leading home valuation models and methodologies using millions of real-estate transactions and complementary data setsIdentifying, researching, and analyzing new data sourcesBecoming a domain expert in real-estateCollaborating with Software Engineers, Product Managers, and Product DesignersMaintaining development best practices, including test coverage, continuous integration, A/B testing, and documentation Required Skills and Experience Strong Python programming skillsAbility to communicate data-driven insights through easily-understood visualizationsStrong background in statistics and mathematicsAn understanding and ability to implement common supervised and unsupervised learning methodsExperience in SQL, preferably PostgreSQLAbility to transforming business problems and objectives into data-driven solutions Desirable Skills and Experience Previous GIS experienceExperience with Apache AirflowFamiliarity with common AWS services such as EC2, Elastic Beanstalk, RDS and S3Experience with REST APIsWere looking for individuals who bring:Experience with databases, statistics, web services, algorithms, and PythonExperience building modular, scalable, cloud-based systemsWillingness to learn new technologies and a whatever-it-takes attitude towards building the best possible home buying and selling experiences for our usersAmne is currently hiring for our Austin Area and San Francisco Bay Area offices. Amne team members are thoughtful listeners, fast learners, results driven, self-motivated, self-aware, and self-disciplined.
